page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT IN SEAFORD
page.content: { MANY}PEOPLE IN SEAFORD ARE{RETIRED. MOST PEOPLE{WORK IN LONDON, LEWES, {EASTBOURNE, BRIGHTON, OR NEWHAVEN. PEOPLE WHO WORK IN{SEAFORD}WORK IN {SHOPS, WORKSHOPS, OFFICES OR SCHOOLS. THERE ARE NO BIG FACTORIES OR FIRMS EMPLOYING A LARGE NUMBER OF WORKERS. WOMEN SOMETIMES WORK PART_TIME IN SHOPS, CAFES, PLAYGROUPS OR OFFICES. MOST {MOTHERS}ARE{HOUSEWIFES. SOME PEOPLE ARE{SELF_EMPLOYED.}SOME PEOPLE ARE{GARDENERS OR HOME HELPS}FOR THE{ELDERLY.}LOTS OF MEN TRAVEL FOR THEIR JOBS. {UNEMPLOYMENT}IS NOT A GREAT PROBLEM IN SEAFORD, BUT MANY SCHOOL_LEAVERS CANNOT FIND JOBS. MANY{YOUNG PEOPLE}DELIVER NEWSPAPERS OR WORK ON SATURDAYS BEFORE THEY LEAVE SCHOOL.
